intro: Haplophyllum bastetanum, commonly known as the Madagascar starleaf, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which is typically associated with cacti, but this species exhibits more herbaceous characteristics. The plant is distinguished by its star-shaped leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the dry season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
